"How do you know Katila likes horses?" Shiloh asked in surprise.

Serenia smiled slightly: "I also know that your favorite slave girl is called Alesha."

Xiluo suddenly felt a chill running down his spine: Did I accidentally reveal it to her last night when we were in bed?

"Cerenya... I wish—"

Before he finished speaking, he was interrupted by Serenia: "Shiro, my husband, you don't have to worry about anything!" Serenia's expression at this moment was extremely solemn: "My mother has taught me how to manage a family since I was a child. Don't worry, especially when you are about to go to war, I will manage the family well and will not cause you any trouble. "Katila is still young and playful. She doesn't know how to manage a home, so you are still in charge of the household affairs. Just don't restrict them too much. Katila likes to go out to play, so let her go out; Alessia likes to raise livestock, so let her raise livestock. And you--" Shiloh stroked Serenia's face and said softly, "I know you have a talent for business, but because of the so-called Greek family tradition, you can't give full play to it. Here, you don't have to worry about these. I will give you some of my industries to manage, receive customers, contact merchants, you can do everything according to your wishes." Shiloh said to her seriously.

"...But this is against the law! Especially since you are a king, you should set an example!" Although Serenia was very happy to hear this, years of education told her how unorthodox her husband's words were!

"Law? Poseidon has no law that restricts women like this! Therefore, as the king and queen of Poseidon, we need to create new traditions for it!" Hiro's passionate words infected Serenia, and she also felt proud and happy that she had found a unique and good husband. She hugged Hiro with both hands, and her plump and elastic breasts pressed against Hiro's arms, making him feel dependent on her.

"Serenia, let's go horseback riding too!" Serenia was about to say she didn't know how to do it, but Shiloh whispered something in her ear, and her pretty face, as white as jade, turned red like clouds.

…

Mount Haiestrum is the highest of the mountains that blocked the Brutti from going south. It is the residence of the mountain god Nim worshipped by the Brutti, so it is also called the sacred mountain. At the foot of the mountain to the north is a relatively flat open area.

Early in the morning, Worm and the warriors from two neighboring tribes crossed the rugged mountain roads and hurried here.

When the warriors sat down to rest because they had reached their destination, Badru, the leader of Worm, was furious: "Serasim is obviously closer to the sacred mountain than us, but that old bastard Strom hasn't shown up with his people yet. Does he really think that he is the first initiator and that he is the leader of this coalition?! What's so arrogant about that! Bah, if you make me angry, take your people back immediately! When that happens, I really want to see what his expression will be!"

"Chief, don't be angry! Serasim hasn't arrived yet, this is a good opportunity!" A Worm elder looked around and whispered, "We can now discuss with other tribes who should lead the attack on Tusim this time."

Bartlu stroked his thick beard and grinned. He sat on a rock, holding a short spear in his hand, looking back at the Brutti people who were rushing towards here from the undulating hills and the woods. He stood up suddenly and said, "Let's go and greet them, and show our sincerity!"

…

Afor was a native of Volm, and he was an active supporter of Volm joining the coalition. He had long been tired of life in Volm, which was surrounded by high mountains covered with snow all year round. If there was a big cold wave, half of the cattle and sheep he had worked hard to raise would die. Tusim represented wealth in the eyes of the Brutti, so when Bartlu told him why he wanted to join the coalition, Afor was very happy.

At this moment, when everyone else sat down to rest, he was still looking at Mount Haystack excitedly, fantasizing about the land south of the mountain that he was about to set foot on.

"Hey, why are there tribes coming from the south?" someone said in surprise.

Upon hearing this, Afor looked and saw a number of Brutti people coming out of the forest opposite. They were holding short spears and wooden shields, and were walking towards this side in a loose formation, waving and greeting as they walked.

Just as Afor was wondering if there were any other tribes nearby, more and more people came out of the forest in front of him, and they were getting closer and closer to Worm. He suddenly felt a little uneasy.

At this moment, a trumpet sounded, and the Brutti in front stopped in unison and raised their spears.

It's the enemy! As soon as this thought flashed through his mind, the sky above his head was covered with dense short spears.

He hurriedly raised his wooden shield, only to hear screams all around him. Those defenseless tribesmen who were lying, sitting, resting, or chatting with others were pierced by short spears one by one, and they didn't know what happened before they died!

After throwing a round of short spears, the enemy rushed towards Worm and his men like a surging tide.

Afor was frightened by the enemy's bravery. He hastily threw away his weapon and ran away. Many people chose to flee like him. They didn't set up camp or form a formation. They had just been hit by a rain of spears. They didn't have the courage to fight the enemy.

Those soldiers who were slow to react were stabbed down by the rushing enemies, and their miserable screams made the others run desperately.

Bartlu and his elders were talking to the leader of another tribe, and then they saw their own people running away in terror.

"Stop right there!" Bartulu's angry roar was like throwing a stone into a rushing river. It had no effect at all. Instead, he was swept away by his fellow tribesmen and fled backwards.

Panic quickly spread to the tribes that arrived later. Some people didn't even know what was happening and ran for their lives.

In an instant, the whole mountain and plain were filled with defeated soldiers...

This chaotic scene lasted for about two hours before the frightened Brutti finally calmed down.

The enemy had long since disappeared without a trace. The tribes gathered the fleeing soldiers and counted their numbers, finding that the number of casualties was not high. The main losses came from the round of short spears thrown, as well as trampling and falls during the escape. After all, without cavalry, it was very difficult for infantry to catch up with the infantry who were running away at full speed.

Worm suffered the most casualties, and what was worse was that more than half of the cattle and sheep they brought with them were taken away by the enemy. This made Bartulu extremely angry, and the other tribes secretly frightened. They did not expect that the weak Tusim (they thought it was Tusim who did it) would dare to run to the hinterland of the coalition and attack them. This reminded them of the former tyrannical Tusim, and they began to feel uneasy. Volume 3 Chapter 63: It is better to attack than to wait

The place that Kallikretu pointed to was right between the two roads, to the north of the border between Tusim and the original Kelam territory.

"Kallikretu chose a good place. No matter which route they take, we can threaten their flanks and rear!" Picos praised sincerely after thinking about it.

"Hey, this place is so far away from our Poseidon City. It will probably take half a day to get there. How do we solve the food problem? Even if we only stay here for one day, the amount of bread consumed will probably not be a small number. Who will transport it? Who will supply it?" Just when everyone agreed with Callikretus' opinion, Sulmus raised questions based on his duties.

Everyone fell silent. They all knew that after several months of consumption, the city-state had very little food left. If Poseidon sent out a team of a thousand people, the food would not be enough for a day.

"Since we are running low on food, I think we should retreat to the city and wait for the enemy to get close to the Adrothene River before engaging them in a decisive battle!" Nurnusis suggested.

"This won't do! Are we just going to let the enemy trample on our farmland on the north bank?!" Misconon objected.

"There's no other way. You know the importance of food to soldiers." Nurnusis said helplessly.

Dorisa listened to everyone's conversation, but his eyes were fixed on Shiloh who seemed to be deep in thought. His heart tightened, and he said, "Don't worry about the food, we Tusim will provide it!"

After hearing this, Xi Luo was deliberately stunned and said, "How can this be possible!"

"Since you said that Poseidon and Tusim are a family, then Tusim is willing to help his relatives!" Dorisa was heartbroken about the heavy bleeding, but she had to pretend to be generous and selfless: "It's just that Tusim's food reserves are not much, and it is estimated that they can only provide three days of food."

"Three days is enough!" Hilo said to Surmus with an excited expression, "Tusim has provided us with help so generously, and Tarantum has gained so much benefit from Tusim and Poseidon. We are also helping them by fighting against the Brutti! How can they just stand by and watch! Go to Tarantum and ask for help from their council!"

"Yes, my king," Solmus replied.

"Elder Dikwi, I wonder how long the food supply of the Brutti coalition can last?" Shiloh finally understood. Although Dorisa was the leader, Dikwi was the wise one when it came to marching and fighting.

"According to our tradition, half of the food should be brought by each tribe, and the other half should be provided by the organizer. Spring is when each tribe has the least food. Serasim and Worm are not wealthy tribes, so it's quite good if they can survive for two or three days. Back then, when the old chief led the coalition army from here to the battle with Tarantum, it took a total of two days..."

Dicvir's words surprised them. Picos, Nurnusius and others were from Athens. In the decades of war between Athens and Sparta, the larger battles often lasted for more than seven or eight days, and the Sicily expedition lasted for more than a year. Since the two Greek allies were very wealthy and had sufficient logistical support, they forgot that the Brutti tribes could not compare with Athens and Sparta at all. They had neither sufficient food nor money to buy it. They were a bit like the early Greek city-states. Citizens went to war in the early morning and could go home to eat in the afternoon.

However, the Brutti were different from the Greeks in that they were good at robbing. It was because they saw that there were few people in Tusim and not many citizens of Bosaiah that they thought that even if the Tusim stronghold was steep, they could easily break through it with their large numbers.

Everyone was thinking about Dickwei's words, and Kallikretu seemed a little annoyed.

Shiloh noticed their expressions and said with a smile, "Kallikretu has chosen a good place. If we camp here, we can not only fight them earlier to prevent them from destroying the territories of Poseidon and Tusim, but it will also be convenient for us to attack!"

"Attack?" Everyone was stunned.

"Yes, we can't just wait for the enemy to attack." Shiloh said confidently: "We can take the initiative to attack and undermine their morale."

He turned his gaze to Dikwi: "Where do you think the teams sent by the various tribes of Brutti will meet?"

…

After discussing Poseidon's dispatch of troops, Hero and Katila's wedding ceremony was supposed to be held. In order to respect Tusim, Hero decided to adopt the tradition of the Brutti people - the bonfire wedding. At this time, he learned that Katila had gone to see Serenia, and he panicked. The scene of the two women fighting each other immediately emerged in his mind. He immediately left the hall and went straight to the backyard.

As soon as he entered the yard, he heard the neighing of horses.

"Hey, Shiloh, how do you think I ride?" Wasn't it Katira who was sitting on the tall horse? Even though the slaves led the horse and let her stroll slowly in the yard, she still looked very proud.

"Very good!" Shiloh said against his will.

"Oh, you've already learned to please her before you even enter the room!" Hearing this, Xi Luo's heart tightened. He turned around and saw that Serenia looked unhappy, and hurriedly said with concern: "Just now I heard that Kadila came to see you, I was very worried about you, so I came."

"Why are you worried about me? Are you afraid that she will beat me?" Serenia frowned.

Shiloh didn't dare to speak anymore.

Serenia stepped forward and took her husband's arm. Although she was not happy that her husband was shared by others, she knew that it was not entirely the fault of Hero. When Poseidon told Tarantum about Tusim's proposal, many people in Tarantum agreed, and even her father Grinus came to persuade her.

Who told him to be the king of a city-state? Serenia felt helpless, but she changed her mind and thought: the man she chose was very caring and considerate. She was very moved by the song he sang for her yesterday and his worry just now. You know, orthodox Greek women don't have much freedom. When they are young, they are controlled by their parents, after they get married, they are controlled by their husbands, and when they are old, they are controlled by their sons. Serenia has seen many unfortunate women in Tarantum, including her mother. Although her father did not have two wives, he would rather break the law (the laws of most Greek city-states stipulate that as a couple, they must have sex at least once a month) than enter his mother's bedroom and stay with prostitutes or female slaves every day.

As long as Xiluo always keeps caring for her, that's enough! Serenia thought to herself, half leaning against Xiluo, looking at the extremely excited Katira and said, "I gave her a horse from the dowry I brought. Look, she is so happy!" Chapter 143:
Volume 3 Chapter 65 The Necessary Battle - From City-State to Empire

Bartulu blamed the failure on Serasim, angrily accusing him of having been late in arriving, which had allowed the enemy's raid to succeed.

However, Serasim countered that it was because of Worm's own lack of preparedness that he dragged everyone down.

The quarrel between the two large tribes forced the small tribes affiliated with them to join in, which made the argument last for more than half an hour. Finally, with the mediation of Feixia, a new agreement was reached: Serasim would supply food to Worm, and after defeating Tusim, Serasim would obtain Tusim's iron mine.

This agreement was obviously beneficial to Serasim, but the irritable Bartulu actually agreed to it at this moment. He knew that Volm was seriously weakened this time. If he didn't cooperate, the alliance might break up and Volm would suffer a great loss. He thought that he should accept this matter first and then talk about it after defeating Tusim. At the same time, he hated Feiqiya who gave Serasim advice.

Next, the tribal leaders discussed how to advance. Since most tribes were worried about being attacked by Tusim again, they gave up the idea of ​​​​taking the river valley. The river valley road was easy to take and the distance was short, but the road was narrow and on one side was the rushing Budano River, which was not conducive to the deployment of the troops. In addition, the previous enemy also came from the direction of the river valley.

In the end, they chose to walk to the west, which was a longer journey. The undulating hills there might give other races a headache, but for the Brutti people who were accustomed to living in the mountains, it was the best shelter. It was also beneficial for them to deploy their team and take advantage of their large numbers.

As the sun shone its blazing heat at the center of the sky, the demoralized Brutti coalition began to march south.

After two hours of trekking, the land beneath their feet became flatter and flatter. If they continued walking, they would soon enter Tusim's territory, and the exhausted coalition soldiers became more excited.

At this moment, they saw a white light shining on a hill on the left side in front of them. They were surprised and found that the hill was full of warriors, and the dazzling white light was the result of their armor and weapons shining in the sun.

"It's the enemy! Enemy!!..." The coalition forces became panicked again.

Under such circumstances, the whole army had to stop and rest to recover their strength. The leaders of each tribe gathered together to discuss countermeasures.

"Feicia, you swore to the god of Mount Nim that the combined number of Tusim and Poseidon's warriors would not exceed four hundred. We formed this team because we believed in you! Now go and see, there are at least eight or nine hundred enemies on the hill! I don't know if you didn't know how to count or if you made a deliberate mistake for some other reason!!" At the beginning of the meeting, Bartulu criticized Feiqia.

"Yes, if I had known that there were so many of them, my tribe would never have participated! Maybe you reduced their number by more than half because you were afraid that we would not participate. This is probably not just your idea!" A tribal leader who was on good terms with Worm also raised questions and blamed Serasim.

Seeing the dissatisfied expressions of the crowd, Feiqia seemed very calm. He said confidently: "Chief Bartulu, when I first met you, I said that Tusim and Poseidon were at their weakest at that time. If you want to occupy their land, you should attack them immediately! I have said this to every leader present, but due to some people's reasons, the coalition was not formed until now. During this period of time, I heard that Poseidon was recruiting citizens from other Greek city-states, and now these extra enemies should be Poseidon's new citizens. I think you should know very well who should be responsible for the current situation!"

Feqia's aggressive words made Bartulu's face darken. Just as he was thinking about how to insult this ignorant and helpless dog, the leader of Serasim, Strom, said, "Even if the number of citizens in Poseidia has increased a lot, our warriors are still twice as many as theirs! Besides, it's a good thing that they come out to fight. I'm afraid they will hide in the mountain stronghold, which will be a bit troublesome. Chief Bartulu, you can't forget that you are the descendant of the mountain god Nim just because Poseidia has a few more people, and forget that we Brutius are proud of fighting!"

Upon hearing this, Bartulu sneered and said, "Who was the first to escape when we fought against the Greeks last year? And you still have the nerve to say that you are the descendant of the mountain god Nim!"

"You--" Strom's old face turned red.

Fei Qiya coughed a few times and interrupted, "Leaders, although we have a large number of people, the enemy occupies the hill. If we attack forcefully, I'm afraid we will suffer relatively large losses. It is better to ignore them and attack Tusim Stronghold directly. If they come, we will fight them on the flat ground. If they don't come, we can successfully capture Tusim Stronghold!"

While the leaders were still thinking about Feiqia's suggestion, Bartulu sneered again: "It's easy to say to bypass them! Who will go in front and who will go behind? What if they launch a fierce attack on us again? How should we deal with it? I don't want the big retreat this morning to happen again!"

"We can make a plan--" Fei Qiya wanted to give a detailed explanation.

Bartulu interrupted him rudely: "Plan? Does making a plan guarantee that it can be implemented? Look around... There are twenty-three tribes here, not just one tribe! Even if it's just one tribe, we sometimes get annoyed by the constant orders from our tribesmen, let alone twenty-three tribes! Let's form a formation and fight the enemy head-on, no problem! But if you want us to turn our backs to the enemy, without long-term and strict training, I think this is absolutely impossible!"

"Chief Batru, you are right!" Many leaders obviously agreed with what he said.

Feiqia was unconvinced and wanted to refute, but Strom laughed up to the sky and said, "Everyone, the Poseidons thought they had a great advantage by forming a battle array on the hill! But they can be surrounded and annihilated by us. Then, it will be easier to take over their territory!"

"Bartulu, do you dare to compete with me? Each of us will lead half of the warriors to attack from both ends of the hill and see who can reach the top first! The winner will get the Tusim Iron Mine!

"Okay, let's compete!" Bartulu agreed without hesitation.

Feiqiya wanted to say more, but Strom waved his hand to stop him. He said loudly: "Leaders, do you agree to fight them here?"

By this time, the leaders of other tribes had already understood that a decisive battle with the coalition forces of Poseidon and Tusim was their only option. The previous great retreat had left a deep impression on them, and only by relying on this large group of people could they avoid being sacrificed.

Chapter 144:
Volume 3, Chapter 66: The Battle of Poseidon and the Bruttiian Alliance (I) - From City-State to Empire

"My king, what if... they don't attack us?" Picos looked at the dark mass of Brutti warriors sitting on the ground to rest in the distance, and couldn't help but say worriedly.

Shilo pointed at the Brutti without hesitation and said, "As long as they dare to bypass us, we will go down the mountain and attack their flanks and rear! Whether to fight or to flee, this should be the question they are worried about!"

Everyone smiled knowingly, and the tense expressions on their faces relaxed.

Not long after, a low and long horn sounded in Brutti's camp. Brutti's warriors stood up, lined up, and then formed two long dragons and slowly moved towards the hill.

It's finally here! Shiloh clenched his fists.

Seeing the Brutti approaching, Poseidon's soldiers became quite agitated.

Xi Luo frowned and said, "Notify the squad leaders and ask them to comfort their soldiers and let them have a good rest. The enemy hasn't arrived yet, so why panic?"

The messenger Larka hurriedly led several other men to run to the various teams. Because they were in the mountains and could not ride horses, they could only rely on their legs to convey orders.

After receiving the order from Shiloh, Taqiadi suddenly had an idea and shouted, "Brothers, the king asked me to ask you, are you scared? Why are you making such a fuss?"

Immediately, the centurion Agathok stood up and retorted: "Who said we are afraid?! We are happy! Finally, someone sent a head to help us become citizens of Poseidon sooner! Brothers, don't you agree?"

“That’s absolutely right!”

"That's right. Only the new citizens are afraid. We, the First Guard Squadron, will never be afraid and will never fail!"

Their excited shouts reached the ears of Captain Poseidon nearby, and became a weapon for him to encourage his soldiers: "Citizens of Poseidon, do you hear their shouts? Show your courage, and don't let them look down on you!"

"Don't worry, Captain. I will kill more enemies by myself than their entire slave squad will! They just came to Poseidon earlier than us and fought a few more wars. It's nothing big!" Tris said deliberately.

"Come on, Tris, you want to kill people with your strength? Let me kill all the enemies and let those slave soldiers know who is the real pillar of Poseidon!"

…

Shilo looked at the excited soldiers in front of him, listened to Larka's report, and a smile appeared on his face: It seems that he was wrong, the soldiers' desire for this battle exceeded his imagination!

At this time, Brutti's two long dragons were approaching the hill. They did not stop and continued to move towards the two sides of the hill.

After a moment's thought, Hero understood the enemy's intention: "Elder Dikwei, where are Serasim and Worm?" He politely asked Dikwei, who had been observing the Brutti coalition forces beside him.

This time, Tusim sent a hundred warriors to participate in the expedition, led by Dicwe, while Dorisa herself led the rest of the tribe to defend the mountain stronghold. It was because of Dicwe's familiarity with the Brutti tribe that Shilo successfully raided the Brutti coalition. Hammock turned his gaze towards the mountain stronghold in the distance that was surrounded by the Mepeans. He said confidently, "The area north of the Holy Mountain is our territory now. Next it will be the turn of the Poseidon you mentioned."

Feiqia smiled. He seemed to see King Poseidon leading his soldiers to flee in all directions under the attack of the Mepias army, just like the Bruttii Alliance today. He couldn't help but feel a surge of pleasure of revenge in his heart.

…

When Strom saw the entire front line collapse, his mind went blank. He was carried away from the battlefield by the guards in a daze.

Along the way, he murmured weakly: "It's over... It's all over..."

He fled back to the stronghold. Fearing that the Mepeans would take advantage of the chaos to charge into the stronghold, the guards immediately closed the stronghold gate, causing many Brutti warriors who wanted to escape into the stronghold to be blocked outside the gate and were attacked by the Mepeans who followed closely behind, causing a river of blood outside the stronghold gate.

Strom was awakened by a shrill scream. The tragic scene outside the village made him tear his eyes out, and his grief and anger made him stand up again: "The Brutians, take up your spears! If the Brutians are destined to perish today, we must also use our bravery to sacrifice the enemy's bodies to the Wolf God! Let him remember the Brutians' tenacity and perseverance!!"

The people in the entire village slowly gathered behind Strom, trembling with fear.

Strom stared at the people behind him: most of them were old people, women, and even children. They were of different heights and appearances, but the only thing they had in common was the fear that permeated their faces, and the tears that filled their faces because of fear.

When Strom saw his beloved little son struggling to lift a wooden shield that almost covered his entire upper body and looking at him pitifully, he could no longer keep a calm face.

"Chief, the village gate is about to be broken down!" At this moment, the soldier in charge of defending the village wall turned around and shouted urgently.

"For the glory of our ancestors!!!" Strom no longer cared about anything else and shouted at the top of his lungs.

Standing at the front of the team, he put down his spear and stared at the gate nervously.

"Bang!! Bang!!..." The gate of the village that was hit by the huge tree made a series of mournful sounds. Every loud noise made the people behind Strom scream in surprise. Some even burst into tears and threw their spears on the ground in fear.

Strom's heart hit rock bottom.

The Brutti may not see the sun tomorrow... He thought sadly, gazing at the mountains in the distance that were glowing red by the setting sun.

"Woo! - Woo! -" A strong and powerful horn sound broke through the battlefield and reached the mountain village. (To be continued. If you like this work, you are welcome to vote for recommendation and monthly tickets at Qidian. Your support is my greatest motivation.) (To be continued)

Volume 3 Chapter 85 Thor

After a fierce battle, the Mepea warriors repeatedly chased and killed the defeated enemies; Poseidon marched quickly and hurried to the battlefield.

Both sides were very tired. However, the attack of Mepias was scattered and disorderly, like a sudden sun shower, seemingly fierce but actually short-lived; while the attack of Poseidon was like a wave in the sea, especially when the phalanx gathered into a long wall, the overwhelming momentum instantly crushed the confidence of the scattered Mepias.

The Mepeans came like a tide and retreated like a tide. The battle lasted only a moment before the winner was decided.

While Hilo was secretly happy, he could not help but feel regretful: It was a pity that he did not have a strong cavalry, otherwise he could use them to chase and kill the fleeing soldiers, and with this battle, he could seriously damage the vitality of the Mepeans. As for the dozens of slave riders around him who were carefully trained to scout the enemy and serve as messengers, he really couldn't bear to let them get hurt.

While Poseidon's soldiers were chasing the fleeing soldiers, the construction officer had already chosen a campsite: located at the foot of the mountain northeast of the Holy Mountain, close to the exit of the valley, with the Serasim stronghold on the opposite hillside. There were several streams flowing down from the Holy Mountain and merging into the Budano River to the east.

"Excellent campsite, Ventus!" Shiloh praised with satisfaction.

"Because of your guidance, my king." Ventus was not being modest. Before becoming a citizen of Poseidia, he was a bricklayer. During training, Hiro discovered his talent in construction, and immediately promoted him to a construction officer, focusing on cultivating his talent in this area. Although he had commanded the construction of camps many times during training, this was the first time he had used it in actual combat. Hiro's praise was a recognition of him.

Based on the size of the army, Ventus estimated the size of the camp, and then began to direct the slaves to dig two-meter-deep trenches around the camp he had set.

An hour later, the troops returned. In this battle, only 14 people died in Poseidia and more than 50 were injured, while more than 200 people were injured in Mepeia. The main reason was that the results of the pursuit were very limited. How could the fully armed Poseidon soldiers catch up with the poorly equipped and fast-running Mepeans? This made Hero more eager to obtain a powerful cavalry.

The tired Poseidon soldiers could not rest yet. According to military law, they had to build camp first. Hiro knew that one of the reasons why the Roman army was so powerful in the past was that they had a good habit of building camps at any time, which gave them strong support for both offense and defense. So Hiro hoped that the Poseidon people could also integrate this into their blood.

Digging a trench is the first step. Using the soil dug from the trench to build a wall is the second step. Using the wooden parts from the baggage to build three or four sentry towers is the third step. Placing deer antlers in front of the camp, digging pits, and inserting pointed wooden stakes is the fourth step. Finally, set up the tent...

Under the command of the squad leader, the soldiers of each phalanx built the camp in an orderly manner according to the steps in the training, while the cavalry was dispersed to observe the enemy's movements...

…

It was late in the evening, but candles were still lit in Poseidon's camp.

"Your Majesty, on behalf of Chief Serasim and all the people of the tribe, I would like to express my sincerest gratitude to you!" The Serasim envoy knelt on the ground respectfully: "Originally, the chief wanted to come and thank you in person, but because of the powerful enemy, he did not dare to leave, so he asked me to convey his words. He said: 'Serasim will always remember your kindness!'"

"Poseidia and the Brutti people live in the same mountainous area and drink water from the same river. We should help each other like brothers!" Hiro looked at the dozen Brutti tribe envoys kneeling on the ground and said apologetically, "When we heard that the brutal Mepeians had invaded the land here, we, Poseidia, immediately decided to send troops to help. I didn't expect that we were a little late, causing you to suffer huge losses!"

As soon as he finished speaking, a crisp "pop" sounded in the big tent. Five clear fingerprints appeared on the round face of a short fat man, and he burst into tears: "My king, I am so ashamed. Last time I was so confused that I was instigated by others to follow them to attack your territory. Fortunately, you are a real lion, you don't care about the provocation of a small pheasant, and you put aside your hatred and saved us Brutti people. Your heart is as broad as the sea, you are worthy of being..."

The envoys felt somewhat embarrassed when he brought up the past.

While listening to Kozula's translation, Shiloh looked at the fat man with great interest. Most of the Burti people spoke simply and crudely, and it was rare for someone to speak flattering words so fluently.

"You are..." Shiloh asked curiously.

"Your Majesty, I am Thor, the leader of Kuram." The fat man asked respectfully.

"Oh!" Shilo stood up in surprise: "How rude! Quickly bring a chair to Chief Kuram." Shilo originally thought that all the people who came were envoys from the Brutiti tribe, but he didn't expect that there would be a chief as well. Of course, the reception standards had to be raised accordingly.

The messengers looked at Thor with contempt as he sat down.

Originally, Kuram was a small tribe, but it was very famous in the alliance because of their chief, Thor. He first attached himself to Tusim, and after the battle between Tusim and the Southern Italian coalition, he turned to Lukeram. Lukeram was destroyed by Poseidia, and he quickly moved closer to Serasim. In the Brutti Alliance, although there was a tradition that small tribes often attached themselves to large tribes to seek shelter, the Brutti people despised Thor's frequent changes of masters and his practice of attaching himself to whoever was the strongest, which led to Kuram's isolation.

"Thor, it seems you have discovered that there is green grass here in Poseidon." Thor's nickname was "Sheep", and the messenger Serasim was mocking him for planning to become a traitor and defect to Poseidon again.

Thor pretended not to hear and said sternly, "The lives of my people of Kuram were given by Poseidon. If I don't come in person, I can't show my gratitude to Poseidon."

The messengers looked embarrassed again.

"At the same time, I implore Poseidon to lead the Brutti tribes to drive the greedy Mepeans out of our land!"

He is indeed a traitor! Hearing the word "lead", the corners of the Serasim envoy's mouth twitched a few times. After looking back at the other envoys, he quickly said: "The Brutti Alliance is willing to form an alliance with Poseidon to fight against Mephia!"

"Yes, our Brutti Alliance is willing to form an alliance with Poseidon to fight against Meppia!" the other envoys said in unison.

"Great! As long as the Brutii and Poseidon work together, they will not be afraid of any enemy!" Hero glanced at Thor and said happily. Deep down, he certainly wanted to become the leader of the Brutii Alliance, but this was not something that could be achieved overnight, and the war was imminent. Rather than letting the Brutii tribes (especially the Serasims) feel dissatisfied and secretly drag their feet, it would be more efficient to maintain the status quo. (To be continued. Volume 3 Chapter 87 Camp Attack and Defense (I)

Now that both parties have agreed to form an alliance, the next step is to discuss how to deal with the enemy.

The Serasim envoy first introduced the situation of the Brutti Alliance: since the Mepeans were repelled, warriors from the Brutti tribes have returned to the Serasim stronghold one after another. Before he left, the number of warriors had reached more than 2,500.

When the messengers heard Picos introduce the situation of Poseidon's expeditionary troops, their faces suddenly changed.

"There are only more than 2,000 soldiers!" someone couldn't help but screamed.

"What's wrong with two thousand people! One Poseidon warrior can defeat three of you Brutti! The battle with Lukelam and the battle with your Brutti Alliance have proved this! What's more, we still have four thousand slaves!" Misconon stood up and said proudly.

The Serasim envoy saluted solemnly: "The Brutti warriors are also not afraid of fighting! But because of the difference in numbers, we failed. We don't want to fail again for the same reason! Because the Brutti people can never fail again!"

As soon as these words were spoken, all the messengers looked solemn and the tent suddenly became silent.

Shiloh looked at them and felt more confident of winning.

"Do you have enough food?" he asked.

"It can last for a month." The Serasim messenger replied. In order to resist Mephia and for safety, some tribes moved to the Serasim stronghold. In this war, more than half of the Brutti warriors were lost, so the food could actually last longer.

This adds another hope of winning, Shiloh thought.

…

When the messengers came out of the military tent, they were both excited and doubtful: Could they really win the battle according to King Poseidah's arrangement?

Everyone has this question in their mind.

"Go back and tell your leader that as long as Poseidon and the Brutti alliance work closely together, I will give them a glorious victory!" The confident voice of Hilo behind them seemed to dispel the haze in their hearts.

A glorious victory? Thor looked at Poseidon's camp under the silver light of the moon. Seeing the camp built by Poseidon in just one dusk and evening made him decide to come to Poseidon in person to express his closeness. As for whether to surrender or not, it depends on the final outcome.

Meipia was also an option, but he was unwilling to make such a choice until it was a matter of life and death. Before that, he had to continue to endure the contempt of other tribes. He was used to it anyway. This was the humiliation that a small tribe had to endure in order to survive.

…

Before the morning mist had lifted from the valley, Mepiah's army had already appeared at the foot of the Holy Mountain.

Although they had received the news last night, the Mepeans were still shocked when a military camp suddenly rose up on the originally flat battlefield. Because how could this be a camp? In just one night, the Poseidons built a simple mountain stronghold!

The great chief felt palpitations. As a chief, he knew very well that to build a relatively well-defended military camp in such a short time, Poseidon's mobilization, organization and obedience abilities were terrifying. These abilities were far beyond the reach of the loose alliance of the Mepiah tribes.

He hesitated and asked for an immediate tribal military meeting on the battlefield.

"Attack! We must attack immediately! If we don't attack now, it will be much harder to attack once they have completely repaired the barracks!"

"How about we attack Serasim? Didn't we almost take it yesterday?"

"Fool, that's because there were not enough warriors in the Serasim stronghold. Now it's probably full of Brutti people. Serasim is much more dangerous than this military camp!"

"I don't believe that the Poseidons are made of iron. It must have taken a lot of effort to build this camp. How much energy do they have left to fight with us warriors today?"

"Didn't that Brutti say last night that there were only 1,000 enemies? We were scared away by such a small number of people. We will only be laughed at by the women when we go back!"

Fei Qiya wanted to say that he just stood at a distance yesterday and roughly counted the number of people from Poseidia, and then roughly estimated it based on the size of Poseidia City, which was not accurate. But in the fanatical eyes, he did not refute, but only cast an apologetic look to the chief.

The chief sighed. The long-term battle with pirates had made the Mepias develop a warlike habit. The defeat of Mepias yesterday was considered to be a despicable sneak attack by Poseidon. The warriors were clamoring for revenge. With most of the chiefs eager to fight, it was difficult for him to stop them alone.

…

When the Mepeans appeared, the alarm was sounded in the Poseidon camp.

Hilo walked out of the tent fully armed. Picos came up to him and said nervously, "My lord, the Mepeans are coming!"

"Oh." Shiloh put on his helmet and looked around: Soldiers were coming out of various tents one by one, running quickly to line up in front of the earth wall. The whole process was in an orderly manner.

Shiloh then asked, "How many people are there?"

"I went up to the watchtower and saw that it was pitch black. There should be a lot of them, but there was fog and I couldn't see clearly," Picos replied.

"It would be best if everyone came. If it's a field battle, Poseidon alone won't be their match. But if we're defending the camp, the newly joined slaves can play a role."

"Picos, you lead ten squads to defend the left side! Misconon leads ten squads to defend the right side! I will lead the guard squad to defend the center! Secito, lead those slaves as backup! Let's teach these arrogant Mepias a lesson!"

"My king, do you want to light fireworks?" asked Misconon.

Shiloh smiled and said, "It's hard to catch the big fish, don't scare them away."

The number of Mepiah warriors was no more than 10,000, less than twice the number of Poseidon (including the newly joined slaves), yet they dared to "attack the city". Did they really think this military camp belonged to Nine!

…

"Soldiers!" Mis stood in front of the formation with his head held high, looking at the citizen soldiers of Poseidia with a serious expression, but his hand subconsciously pulled the red cloak behind him, revealing the pride he wanted to hide in his heart. Think about a year ago, he was still an ordinary citizen of Athens, and as an ordinary heavy infantryman, he almost lost his life in the expedition to Sicily. And not long ago, Picos, Misconon, Nurnusis, and Callikretto were all promoted to squadron leaders by Hilo. According to the "Poseidian Military Law", the squadron leader should be in charge of ten squads, with a total of 676 people. (The first squad in the squadron has more people than the other squads, a total of 100 people, and is called the honor squad). It's just that Poseidia doesn't have so many soldiers yet, so it can't be realized for the time being, but this is enough to make Misconon happy, and he even feels that his position in the The army can give him more glory than his administrative position.
